definition: from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor

sentences.english: Other art critics have suggested that Kemp has succumbed to a fantasy.
sentences.chinese: 其他艺术批评家也认为坎普屈从于幻想。

sentences.english: Unhappy marriages or relationships are the result of subjugating oneself to one's spouse or partner.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的婚姻或恋情是一个人屈从于配偶或伴侣的结果。
或至少是屈从于某种异端学说？

sentences.english: We should thus subordinate the prevention of first offences to the prevention of recidivism .
sentences.chinese: 这样一来，我们便会让预防初犯屈从于预防累犯。
它使黎巴嫩和加沙屈从。

sentences.english: The publisher complied, but sent all its unexpurgated copies abroad.
sentences.chinese: 出版商屈从了，但同时也把未删节的副本送到了国外。

sentences.english: Some countries, however, indicated their unhappiness at the kowtowing to China.
sentences.chinese: 一些国家则因为屈从于中国表达了不满。

sentences.english: Don't allow peer pressure to force you into an inauthentic role。
sentences.chinese: 不要在压力的屈从下扮演不真实的自己。

sentences.english: In experimental settings, people were subjected to free-riders who exploited them.
sentences.chinese: 在一项研究中里，人们屈从于搭便车者的剥削。

sentences.english: The stubborn student finally began to buckle under.
sentences.chinese: 那个倔强的学生最后开始屈从了。

sentences.english: Watching the sun reflection hypocritical face the world, there are those who succumb to the people should be together.
sentences.chinese: 看着阳光反射世人虚伪的脸，还有那些屈从应合的人。

sentences.english: She accused the government of a cowardly surrender to big-business interests.
sentences.chinese: 她指责政府畏首畏尾屈从于大企业的利益。

sentences.english: As one of the undead, Sylvanas was subject to the iron will of the Lich King.
sentences.chinese: 作为不死族的一员，希尔瓦娜斯屈从于巫妖王的意志。

sentences.english: Let me not bend my heart to the yoke of the many.
sentences.chinese: 别让我摧折自己的心来屈从别人的支配。

sentences.english: I mean, can (critics) imagine somehow that the economics department has been prostituted by corporate America?
sentences.chinese: 我的意思是，经济系已经屈从于美国企业吗？

definition: to surrender/to succumb/to yield/(as a transitive verb) to defeat/to prevail over
to let (sth happen)/to allow (sb to do sth)/to submit to/to yield
to give oneself wholly to/to put oneself at sb's service/(of a woman) to give one's body to/to marry
to bow down to everything sb says or does/to act submissively in order to ingratiate oneself
to drift and live without purpose (idiom); to drag out an ignoble existence
to comply with/to follow (directives)/to defer (to the judgment of superiors)
bowed head and ears glued (idiom); docile and obedient/at sb's beck and call
to allow (sb to do as he pleases)
